column4: Hey, can somebody guide me to get the inbuilt webcam working for my computer?
open terminal and type lspci and pastin it
i typed in lspci what now?
copy the results and paste them in pastebin.org and provide the link
which app are you using for web cam?
i have pasted the links http://imagebin.org/82830 and http://paste.ubuntu.com/366832/
I dont see any webcam there..
i have webcam on my computer which is not being detected. what should i do now?
can you please give the name of the web cam.( make and model)
i have sony vaio CR343N model. I had Vista installed which detected and webcam worked fine where as the switch to ubuntu has caused it to stop working. Does it help
which version of ubuntu are you using?
ubuntu 9.10
i installed 8.10 then upgraded to 9.04 and then to 9.10
it turns out ubuntu dont have the driver

one more query I have is, when I installed UBUNTU I did not care to go for the partition, but now when this is installed can I get some feature like disk compression so that i can partition the disk without losing current installation
you can do resizing of partition without compressing
you have to run live cd of ubuntu and use gparted in live session to resize partition
does this have any specific thing that i should remember or the automatic guide is enough
and i have ubuntu 8.10 live cd
when resizing everything you have to do manually
thanx i will try this in some time
np :)
i am srry abt the last time can this be some virus as there are other activities
ubuntu == no virus
